alert.note: Alert for East Glacier Park Region; Northern High Plains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 16 at 9:07AM MST until January 18 at 11:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 7 and 17 inches. * WHERE...Eastern Glacier National Park and adjacent foothills and plains. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 11 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Hazardous wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow develops tonight and continues through Wednesday with periods of moderate to locally heavy snow developing late Wednesday and Wednesday night. In addition colder temperatures and gusty north winds could create additional wind chill and travel hazards Wednesday night through Thursday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.

area.areaDesc: East Glacier Park Region; Northern High Plains
